author: zach-folwick
body: basic changes to get MMI.Native library working, and to allow unit-testing of the CIM library. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/powershell/powershell/579)

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
See comments, then squash down. The net result of this looks like just one change, "Add CIM xUnit tests".

Also, I think these tests would fail without additional changes, right?

comments.author: zach-folwick
comments.body: @andschwa these tests all pass currently.  As in, users are able to create a new CimInstance with a string representing class name (very basic functionality, but also very important for the previous dsc efforts) `new CimInstance(InstanceHandle)` and other overloads would likely fail, although the code is certainly there to get it passing.  I'll create a separate WI to add CimInstance tests for overloaded constructors.

comments.author: paulcallen
comments.body: Any tests that create objects also need to close them in the same test. NewInstance and NewApplication versions need to close the object. That also makes sure the function table worked also which is the most basic test possible.

comments.author: zach-folwick
comments.body: changed this WI to reflect more closely the work being done.  #550 deals with the implementation of CimInstance and the native InstanceMethods, while this deals with testing of these methods.

comments.author: andschwa

comments.body: Not yet.  There's a lot going on right now, and a lot of additions.  Things are failing in unit tests, and sometimes not in a hello world app.  I'm tracking issues now in the other WI #550
